sub_topic: Finding the area of a trapezoid.
message_1: A trapezoid has a height of 6 cm, a base of 8 cm, and a top base of 12 cm. What is the area of the trapezoid?
message_2:
To find the area of a trapezoid, you can use the formula:

Area = (1/2) × (sum of bases) × height

In this case, the bases are 8 cm and 12 cm, and the height is 6 cm. So the formula becomes:

Area = (1/2) × (8 + 12) × 6

Area = (1/2) × 20 × 6

Area = 10 × 6

Area = 60 square centimeters

The area of the trapezoid is 60 square centimeters.
